content.title: Mixed Arterial-Venous Ulcer Management
content.description: Approach to ulcers with combined arterial and venous insufficiency

key_concepts.details: Ulcers in patients with both venous disease and peripheral arterial disease
ABI 0.5-0.8: modified compression (reduced pressure); ABI <0.5: address arterial disease first
Lower compression pressures (23-30 mmHg vs 40 mmHg for pure venous)
Revascularize first if critical limb ischemia; then address venous component

content.clinical_significance: Standard compression contraindicated in significant arterial disease
content.statement: Mixed Arterial-Venous Ulcer Management is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Wound-Care that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.
